Brex Cardholders Now Get Approved, Seamless Integrations with QuickBooks, Expensify and Xero

SAN FRANCISCO, CA - June 6, 2019 - Brex, the smartest corporate card in the room, today launched its accounting partner program, including a portal to help its customers find an accounting provider that best fits their needs. In connection with the portal launch, Brex is also announcing that its best-in-class integrations with major accounting software and expense management providers are now each officially approved by the Expensify, QuickBooks and Xero software platforms.

With the enhanced integrations, Brex customers can now not only export their Brex transactions to accounting software, but can also add additional customization for their internal accounting classes, locations and departments. The upgrades also bolster popular Brex features including receipt matching and management, as well as clean categorization of vendor spend on Brex cards within accounting and expense software.

“Since its launch, Brex has invested in helping streamline the accounting processes of its customers - saving them time and money - while also investing in accounting advice and infrastructure to support customers. Today’s product announcement combines those two investments” said Michael Tannenbaum, Chief Financial Officer at Brex.

All accounting firms that are accepted to the Brex accounting portal before June 30, 2019 will get an instant upgrade to Premium partner status, giving them access to a dedicated account manager, premium support for their customers, and co-branded marketing and educational material. Additionally, accounting partners will benefit from waived card fees for all their customers and an opportunity to have a full profile in the partner directory, which they can use to promote special offers to Brex customers seeking accounting services.

“Partnering with Brex has reinforced Kruze's premium brand in the startup community. Our customers love the product and have come to associate the quality of the Brex experience with the quality of our team. Working with Brex has been a true win-win for us," added Vanessa Kruze, CEO of Kruze Consulting.

Visit brex.com/partners/accounting to sign up today.

About Brex

Brex is transforming B2B payments by creating corporate cards, rewards, and travel programs that are tailored to specific industries. In 2018 Brex launched the first corporate card and rewards program specifically designed for startups. By rebuilding the credit card tech stack from the ground up, Brex is able to reimagine every aspect of corporate cards, including underwriting, transparency and approvals, to create a radically better experience for customers. Brex is backed by Y Combinator Continuity, Peter Thiel, Max Levchin and more and has raised $215M in equity and $100M in debt capital. The company’s headquarters are in San Francisco.
